item.title: Metals Mixed Amid China Property Worries
item.description: Base metals were mixed, while gold ticked lower in early London trading, with worries over demand, especially in China, hitting markets.

item.title: Ten-Year Bund Yield Could Approach Year-To-Date Highs
item.description: The upside in bond yields still seems to be the path of least resistance for now and 10-year Bund yields could oscillate a bit higher toward the year-to-date highs, but breaching key highs would require a better economic outlook, Commerzbank said.

item.title: Foxconn's Second-Quarter Net Slips as Revenue, Margin Decline
item.description: Foxconn Technology Group said its second-quarter net profit declined 0.9% from a year earlier as revenue fell and margins deteriorated.

item.title: German Economy's Weakness Seen a Burden on Euro
item.description: Although eurozone economic growth in the second quarter was slightly better than expected, the underlying trend remains weak and a likely recession in Germany has become a burden on the euro, DZ Bank said.

item.title: Exor Becomes Long-Term Investor in Philips
item.description: Exor has taken a 15% stake in Philips for an undisclosed sum but worth around €2.6 billion and will be able to nominate one board member.

item.title: Chinese EV Makers' Shares Fall on Worries About Further Price Cuts
item.description: Shares of Chinese electric-vehicle makers listed in Hong Kong broadly weakened early Monday, as they engaged in new price war which investors believe could hurt their margins.

item.title: China's Worsening Economy Is Hurting Corporate America
item.description: Caterpillar and DuPont are among the big companies that are lowering their expectations for a postpandemic boom.

item.title: Argentines Back Far-Right Outsider in Presidential Primary
item.description: Javier Milei has pledged to dissolve the central bank, slash spending in a country hammered by inflation, poverty and a moribund economy.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.3% on Worries Over Higher U.S. Rates
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei closed down 1.3%, reversing earlier gains over worries about higher U.S. rates following Friday’s hotter-than-expected PPI data.

item.title: Chinese Developers' Shares Slump on Country Garden News, Weak Credit Data
item.description: Shares of Chinese property developers fell sharply weighed by negative news, including property giant Country Garden’s suspension of bond trading, deteriorating credit data and profit alerts.

item.title: The Economic Losers in the New World Order
item.description: Giant subsidies and rising protectionism are upending decades of free trade. Smaller countries, from the U.K. to Singapore, are getting left behind.

item.title: The Economic Losers in the New World Order
item.description: Giant subsidies and rising protectionism are upending decades of free trade. Smaller countries, from the U.K. to Singapore, are getting left behind.

item.title: U.S. Steel rejected an unsolicited offer from rival Cleveland-Cliffs, stopping for now a deal that would significantly reshape the domestic steel industry.
item.description: U.S. Steel rejected an unsolicited offer from rival Cleveland-Cliffs, stopping for now a deal that would significantly reshape the domestic steel industry.

item.title: Carl Icahn is fighting for his investment company's survival after a short-seller attack nearly halved its value, propelling the billionaire into one of the most trying periods of his six-decade career.
item.description: Carl Icahn is fighting for his investment company’s survival after a short-seller attack nearly halved its value, propelling the billionaire into one of the most trying periods of his six-decade career.

item.title: Texas sued British oil giant Shell and the other owner of apetrochemical and refinerycomplex near Houston that caught fire in May over alleged environmental damage.
item.description: Texas sued British oil giant Shell and the other owner of a petrochemical and refinery complex near Houston that caught fire in May over alleged environmental damage.

item.title: The police force of Marion, Kan., raided the office of a local newspaper and the home of its owners, seizing personal cellphones and computers in a case legal experts say is likely unprecedented in modern times.
item.description: The police force of Marion, Kan., raided the office of a local newspaper and the home of its owners, seizing personal cellphones and computers in a case legal experts say is likely unprecedented in modern times.

item.title: The Georgia district attorney who investigated alleged 2020 election interference by Trump will begin presenting evidence to a grand jury in Atlanta early this week, according to witnesses summoned to appear.
item.description: The Georgia district attorney who investigated alleged 2020 election interference by Trump will begin presenting evidence to a grand jury in Atlanta early this week, according to witnesses summoned to appear.

item.title: Neeraj Khemlani, president and co-head of the unit that houses CBS News and its TV-station holdings, is resigning and has entered into a content and development deal with parent company Paramount Global.
item.description: Neeraj Khemlani, president and co-head of the unit that houses CBS News and its TV-station holdings, is resigning and has entered into a content and development deal with parent company Paramount Global.

item.title: A 2022 deal to let DuPont sell its sustainable-materials business to a Chinese company while ensuring the technology behind it never left the U.S. hasn't worked as planned, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: A 2022 deal to let DuPont sell its sustainable-materials business to a Chinese company while ensuring the technology behind it never left the U.S. hasn’t worked as planned, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Javier Milei, a far-right outsider in Argentina who pledges to close ministries and slash spending, beat out both conservatives and the ruling Peronist coalition in a primary to choose presidential candidates for October's election.
item.description: Javier Milei, a far-right outsider in Argentina who pledges to close ministries and slash spending, beat out both conservatives and the ruling Peronist coalition in a primary to choose presidential candidates for October’s election.
